Gets the Gremlin databases under an existing Azure Cosmos DB database account with the provided name.

Azure REST API version: 2024-11-15.

Other available API versions: 2019-08-01, 2024-12-01-preview.

These versions are not included in the SDK but you can generate them as a local SDK package; see the [version guide](../../../version-guide/#accessing-any-api-version-via-local-packages) for details.




## Using getGremlinResourceGremlinDatabase {#using}

Two invocation forms are available. The direct form accepts plain
arguments and either blocks until the result value is available, or
returns a Promise-wrapped result. The output form accepts
Input-wrapped arguments and returns an Output-wrapped result.

        <span id="restoretimestampinutc_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#restoretimestampinutc_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">restore<wbr>Timestamp<wbr>In<wbr>Utc</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Time to which the account has to be restored (ISO-8601 format).</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="restorewithttldisabled_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#restorewithttldisabled_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">restore<wbr>With<wbr>Ttl<wbr>Disabled</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies whether the restored account will have Time-To-Live disabled upon the successful restore.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>
